course_title: Topics in German Studies: Emory auf Deutsch
class_notes:
You must have permission to enroll in-person.
This one-credit course meets in person every Friday afternoon for a 50-minute walk and conversation in German on or near Emory's campus. The topics for conversation will vary each week based on the physical and ecological features of the chosen route for that week. Student input will be sought to help determine the routes and topics, and each week students will help serve as guides about particular highlights on the walk. Students will also contribute to the creation of a campus walking tour in German, using Open Tour Builder, an app developed by the Emory Center for Digital Scholarship. All class participants will follow campus safety protocols at all times. 
Assessment:
-	Participation and preparation 50%
-	Three reflective journals 25%
-	Contribution to campus walking tour 25%
Prerequisite: Completion of German 101 or its equivalent or permission of the instructor
course_description: Taught in German. An interdisciplinary course intended to provide in-depth study of formative elements, influences, and movements in German-speaking culture(s). May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
